wikipedia_page.main: Alexander George Foreman (1 March 1914 – 19 June 1969) was an English professional football player who played for Walthamstow Avenue, West Ham United, Tottenham Hotspur and represented the England amateur national football team on one occasion.

link_mentions.page: List of West Ham United F.C. records and statistics
List of Tottenham Hotspur F.C. seasons

response: The 1940 Football League War Cup Final was contested by West Ham United and Blackburn Rovers. It was played on 8 June 1940 and kicked off at 6.30pm despite fears that London would be bombed by the Luftwaffe.  The wartime crowd included wounded members of the BEF recently evacuated from Dunkirk.  West Ham won the tie 1–0; the only goal coming from Sam Small in the 34th minute when he followed up a parried shot from George Foreman.
*George Foreman (born 1949), American boxer, clergyman, writer and businessman

Barron played for Durham City and Blyth Spartans before joining Blackburn Rovers, for whom he made his debut in April 1936. During the Second World War, he played in the North-Eastern League in County Durham, where he was engaged on munitions work. He returned to Blackburn as a guest player for the 1940 Football League War Cup Final, which the Rovers lost to West Ham United. Barron saved a shot from George Foreman before Sam Small scored on the rebound. He resumed his career after the war with Darlington.
George Foreman is an American former professional boxer.
George Foreman may also refer to:
*George Foreman III, entrepreneur, boxer, and son of George Foreman
*George Foreman Grill, an electrically heated grill promoted by George Foreman
